basics.name: Tassia Corcoran
basics.label: Shidler Master's Student
basics.summary: I am pursuing a Master's in Management Information Systems at the University of Hawaii, with an expected graduation date of Fall 2024. I have experience in consulting, teaching, and project management, specializing in technology integration and database development.

work.company: University of Hawaii Computer Sciences Department
work.summary: Teaching and guiding students in computer fundamentals and programming concepts.
highlights: Host weekly open labs with five assistants, ensuring smooth operation and supporting challenging tasks.
Develop engaging lesson plans to facilitate student understanding of HTML, CSS, UNIX, and Microsoft Office.
Provide mentorship to assistants and students, leveraging strong technical expertise.

work.summary: Designing marketing materials and planning engagement events.
highlights: Create graphics for events using tools like Krita and PowerPoint.
Organize large-scale student engagement activities to promote company visibility.
Analyze social media data to identify trends and optimize engagement strategies.

activities.organization: National Center for Women in Technology
highlights: Organize outreach activities to promote the AiC Community on campus.
Foster a supportive environment for women, genderqueer, and non-binary individuals in tech.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognized for achieving a GPA of 3.5 or higher each semester.
